content.webTitle: Observer Food Monthly Awards 2012 Best Cheap Eats: runners up

fields.headline: Observer Food Monthly Awards 2012 Best Cheap Eats: runners up
fields.bodyText: LONDON Pitt Cue Co No reservations because it's so small, which means queues – but don't even think about not waiting. Go for the pulled pork tray and whiskey sours. 1 Newburgh Street,W1F 7RB; pittcue.co.uk Koya Last year's winner made its name with classic udon dishes. But it's the superb daily specials and small plates that make it more than just a noodle bar. Plenty for non-noodle fans, too. 49 Frith Street, W1D 4SG, koya.co.uk Honest Burgers Great, fuss-free burgers. Beef, chicken or veggie fritter – emphasising a few high quality options, as well as great sides such as the house chips and slaw, has made them a winner. Branches in Brixton and Soho, honestburgers.co.uk SOUTH & WEST Fisherton Mill Perfect for afternoon tea after a visit to the gallery or working studios. Try the smoked mackerel pate or scones with damson jam. 108 Fisherton Street, Salisbury, Wiltshire, SP2 7QY; 01722 500 200, fishertonmill.co.uk Thali Cafe A perennial favourite thanks to its simple but delicious take on Indian street food. Try the masala dosa for weekend brunch. Branches across Bristol in Clifton, Easton, Montpelier and Totterdown, thethalicafe.co.uk MIDLANDS Tamatanga Urban Indian canteen with a lively atmosphere to accompany the quick service and exceptionally good value and very tasty Indian food. The Cornerhouse, Trinity Square, Nottingham, NG1 4DB, 0115 958 4848, tamatanga.com Homemade Delightful cafe where everything is prepared fresh on site from suppliers that are mostly just round the corner. A proper local gem. 20 Pelham Street, Nottingham, NG1 2EG; 0115 924 3030, homemadecafe.com EAST Lucca Enoteca Friendly Italian restaurant serving authentic wood-fired pizza, as well as wood-fired roasts at the weekend. 9-43 High Street, Manningtree, Essex CO11 1AH; 01206 390 044, luccafoods.co.uk NORTH Bar San Juan This eccentric little bar wouldn't be out of place in a Spanish backstreet. Be prepared to wait – it's busy for a reason. 56 Beech Road, Chorlton, Manchester M21 9EQ, 0161 8619558 The Settle Down Popular cafe with a slight Italian feel. Great breakfast options and a fully licensed bar for later in the day. 62 Thornton Street, Newcastle upon Tyne, NE1 4AW; 0191 222 0187, thesettledown.com WALES Milgi Lounge Along with the art and music, their delicious 100% vegetarian dishes are all part of Milgi's charm that continues to delight OFM readers. 213 City Road, Cardiff, CF24 3JD, 029 2047 3150, milgilounge.com Ultracomida Spanish deli with a restaurant that serves excellent tapas. Ingredients are sourced and imported from artisan producers in Spain. Restaurants in Aberystwyth and Narberth; ultracomida.co.uk SCOTLAND Eat Cafe Fantastic brunch, lunch and dinner options with a special emphasis on Scottish produce from the team behind Eat Deli in Clarkston. 69 Kilmarnock Road, Shawlands, Glasgow, G41 3YR; 0141 649 6705, eat-deli.co.uk NORTHERN IRELAND Daily Grind Friendly cafe with excellent value lunches. Worth a visit for the banoffee pie alone. 20a St Patrick's Ave, Downpatrick, Co Down, BT30 6DW; 028 4461 7173
